summary: In both 2016 and 2017, 15 U.S. disasters resulted in losses exceeding $1 billion each. To help recover, state and local governments may apply to FEMA for grants for debris removal, public facility repairs, and similar activities. Applicants have two chances to appeal grant decisions. However, we found that, from 2014 to July 2017, FEMA processed only 9% of first-level and 11% of second-level appeals...
title: Disaster Recovery: Additional Actions Would Improve Data Quality and Timeliness of FEMA's Public Assistance Appeals Processing
